intro: Notylia bisepala, commonly known as the two-lobed notylia, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as philodendrons and calla lilies. The plant features a tall, slender stem with broad, arrow-shaped leaves that are often tinged with red or purple at the base. Its inflorescence consists of a spadix surrounded by a spathe, typical of the Araceae family. Notylia bisepala is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
